Events that occurred on 3 October.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1896 - William Morris, artist and author who influenced J.R.R. Tolkien, dies.
1911 - Voice actor Michael Hordern is born.
1936 - J.R.R. Tolkien finishes retyping The Hobbit.
1937 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 16.
1963 - J.R.R. Tolkien posts a letter to Eileen Elgar.
1976 - Oxonmoot 1976 at The Welsh Pony.
1979 - The Jackanory episode "Riddles in the Dark" is aired on the BBC.
1998 - Voice actor Roddy McDowall dies.
2009 - Author Gisbert Kranz dies.
2009 - Ring*Con 2009 in Bonn, Germany.
2010 - Jubilee for Mithlond, the Gothenburg Tolkien Society of Sweden.
2014 - Middle-earth: Shadow of Mordor is released in Europe.
2022 - Production for the second season of The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power series begins in the United Kingdom.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf arrives at Weathertop and marks a stone. At night he is attacked there by the Black Riders. He manages to escape with four Riders behind him.
Together with Strider the four hobbits travel towards Weathertop. They see flashes from the fight at Weathertop while they leave the Midgewater Marshes.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
First Quarter[1]
